solution.text:
Time taken by car = _{{15*j}}_ min
\(\Rightarrow\) Since distance between A and B is constant, speed and time are inversely proportional.
\(\Rightarrow\) Speed \(\times\) time = Distance = K
\(\Rightarrow\) But first we convert all time to minutes. Therefore,
\(\Rightarrow\) 1 hour = 60 min
\(\Rightarrow\) Time taken by auto rickshaw = _{{60*j}}_ min
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore now in case one, K =\( _{{60*j}}_ \times 10 \times _{k}_\)
\(\Rightarrow\) K = _{{600*j*k}}_
\(\Rightarrow\) In the case of the car, speed = _{{40*k}}_
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore time taken = \( \frac {K}{_{{40*k}}_} = \frac {_{{600*j*k}}_}{_{{40*k}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Time taken by car = _{{15*k}}_ min

content.text: An auto rickshaw travels between two places A and B in _{j}_ hours at the constant speed of _{{10*k}}_ km/h. If a car travels at constant speed of _{{40*k}}_ km/h, How much time will it take from A to B?
